User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user account for the Bat-Hacking Christmas website.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

username.description: The user's chosen username for login and display.

definition.description: Stores user account information. Path-based ownership ensures only the authenticated user (or an admin) can access their own data. Includes the 'username'.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user, obtained from Firebase Authentication (request.auth.uid).

firestore.reasoning: This design prioritizes security and scalability for the 'Bat-Hacking Christmas' application. It focuses on authorization independence and clarity. User data is stored under `/users/{userId}`. This allows for simple ownership-based security rules. Usernames are stored as an attribute of the user document. This design avoids complex `get()` calls in security rules, ensuring atomicity of operations. Since this application needs login, authorization is required to display sensitive information. The database-centric authentication (DBAC) approach is adopted; i.e., users are authenticated using Firebase Authentication, and all permissions are derived from their existence as a user and their roles in the database.
